<Summary source="https://washingtonbirthday.com/2026-events">
## Summary: George Washington Birthday Celebration Events

This article outlines the official schedule of events for the **George Washington Birthday Celebration** in Alexandria, Virginia, spanning late January through late February 2026.

### Key Events Relevant to the Question Period (around Feb 20–25):

- **Friday, February 20**: George Washington Memorial Society Reception at the George Washington Masonic National Memorial — a private, formal (white tie) reception for members of the George Washington Memorial Society.

- **Saturday, February 21**:
  - **George Washington Symposium** (9 a.m.–noon) at the George Washington Masonic National Memorial — featuring presentations by researchers on topics including Alexandria archaeology and Washington's relationship with James Monroe. Cost: $50/person.
  - **George Washington Birthday Gala** (6–10 p.m.) at the George Washington Masonic National Memorial — formal banquet with silent auction celebrating Washington's birthday. Cost: $275/person.

### Other Notable Earlier Events:
- **February 14**: The main **George Washington Birthday Parade** in Old Town Alexandria (described as the oldest and largest in the country), themed around the 250th Anniversary of the United States.
- **February 16**: Friendship Firehouse Annual Breakfast and special Gadsby's Tavern Museum hours.
- **Throughout February**: Restaurant Cherry Challenge, Hunt for Washington scavenger hunt, and Hamilton-themed tours.

**Relevance**: Organized public events specifically honoring George Washington are scheduled on **February 20 and 21**, which fall within the question's resolution window (Feb 20–25), potentially driving elevated search interest around those dates.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://www.frauncestavernmuseum.org/gw-ball">
## Summary: George Washington Birthday Ball — Fraunces Tavern® Museum

**Event Details:**
- The **George Washington Birthday Ball** is an annual event hosted by the Sons of the Revolution in the State of New York, Inc. (SRNY)
- **Date: Friday, February 20, 2026** — Reception at 7:00 PM, Dinner at 8:00 PM
- **Venue:** Metropolitan Club, New York
- **Purpose:** To honor George Washington and benefit Fraunces Tavern® Museum

**2026 Special Significance:**
- The 2026 ball will celebrate the **250th Anniversary of the Nation's founding**
- The event will also honor the **United States Space Force** as the newest branch of the armed forces
- **Distinguished Patriot honoree:** Lt. Gen. John Shaw (U.S. Space Force, ret.), former Deputy Commander of the United States Space Command

**Additional Notes:**
- Those unable to attend are encouraged to make a donation to support SRNY and Fraunces Tavern Museum
- A benefit committee list (as of February 6, 2026) is provided, organized into tiers: Benefactors, Patrons, Patriot Leaders, Patriots, and Supporters

**Relevance to Forecast:** This event falls on **February 20, 2026**, which is the start date of the trend window in question, and could contribute to elevated search interest in "George Washington" around that date.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://gwmemorial.org/blogs/news/2026-gala">
## Summary

**Source:** George Washington Masonic National Memorial Association (GWMNMA) — organizational website (reliable, primary source)

### Key Facts:

- The **George Washington Masonic National Memorial** is hosting a **2026 George Washington Birthday Gala Banquet & Live Auction**, described as a celebration of Washington's Birthday.
- The event is noted as **SOLD OUT**.
- The Gala features a **live auction** with collectible items and vacation packages.
- A **Symposium** component is available separately for **$50** per ticket for non-Gala attendees.
- Accommodation is available at the **Hilton Alexandria Old Town** for **$149/night** (room block deadline was **February 1st**).
- Contact for questions/sponsorship: **RWB Tim Strawn**, Director of Development, at 703-786-5424 or tstrawn@gwmemorial.org.

### Relevance to Question:
This article documents a **scheduled, organized event** centered on George Washington's Birthday taking place around the **February 2026** timeframe. The event being sold out suggests notable public interest. This could be a contributing factor to elevated Google Trends search interest around the **February 20–25, 2026** window, as Washington's Birthday (Presidents' Day) falls on **February 16, 2026**.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://time.com/7377739/presidents-day-surprising-facts-history/">
## Summary: "10 Surprising Facts About Presidents' Day" (TIME, Feb. 14, 2026)

### Core Topic
The article covers historical and cultural facts about Presidents' Day (officially "Washington's Birthday"), timed to the upcoming holiday. It features quotes from two named academic sources:
- **Lindsay Chervinsky**, executive director of the George Washington Presidential Library at Mount Vernon
- **Peter Kastor**, history professor at Washington University in St. Louis

### Key Facts Relevant to Google Trends Question

**Holiday Timing:**
- Presidents' Day is observed on the **third Monday of February** each year (in 2026, this would fall on **February 16**)
- The holiday was established by Congress and signed into law by President Hayes on **Jan. 31, 1879**
- The Uniform Monday Holiday Act of 1968 (effective 1971) shifted the observance to Mondays

**Cultural Activities Associated with the Holiday:**
- Patriotic parades, historical reenactments, and readings of Washington's Farewell Address
- Retail "Presidents' Day Sales" became common marketing strategy by the 1980s
- The Senate reads Washington's Farewell Address annually (most recently Feb. 18, 2025, by Sen. Roger Wicker)

### Relevance to the Forecasting Question
The article was published **February 14, 2026**, just before Presidents' Day (February 16, 2026). This suggests elevated media attention to George Washington around mid-February, which may have already contributed to the reported Google Trends value of **100** as of February 16. The question period (Feb. 20–25) falls **after** the holiday, potentially indicating declining search interest post-holiday.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://www.nbcwashington.com/news/national-international/whats-open-closed-presidents-day-this-year/4061234/">
## Summary: What's Open and Closed on President's Day 2026

**Source:** NBC4 Washington | **Date:** February 15, 2026

### Key Facts About Presidents' Day 2026
- Presidents' Day falls on **Monday, February 16, 2026** (the third Monday of February)
- The holiday is **officially called "George Washington's Birthday"** (Washington was born February 22, 1732), though "Presidents' Day" has become the widely used informal name
- It was declared a **federal holiday in 1879**, originally celebrated on February 22nd, then moved to the third Monday of February in **1971**

### What's Closed
- All **non-essential federal offices**, including:
  - U.S. Post Office
  - Libraries
  - Banks
  - Schools
  - Stock market
  - Other non-essential government offices

### What Remains Open
- **Retail:** Walmart, Target, Aldi, Whole Foods, Costco (regular hours)
- **Pharmacy chains:** Walgreens, CVS (pharmacies may have reduced hours)
- **Shipping:** UPS and FedEx (possible delays)
- **Restaurants:** McDonald's, Starbucks, Chick-fil-A, and other major chains

---
*This article is primarily informational about Presidents' Day logistics and has limited direct relevance to Google Trends search interest data.*
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://thepressgroup.net/washingtons-birthday-celebration-set-feb-22-at-historic-new-bridge-landing/">
## Summary

**Source:** Pascack Press & Northern Valley Press, February 17, 2026

The Bergen County Historical Society is hosting a **George Washington's Birthday celebration on Sunday, February 22, 2026**, from 1–4:30 p.m. at Historic New Bridge Landing in River Edge, NJ. Key details include:

- **Re-enactors** from the 3rd New Jersey Regiment will demonstrate Revolutionary War military life
- **Inside the 1752 Steuben House**, visitors can view Revolutionary War artifacts and items from the society's Washington Collection
- **Live 18th-century music and dance** performances by the Tricorne Dance Ensemble at 1:30 and 3 p.m.
- **Historic cooking demonstrations** themed "What Washington Ate — the War Years," featuring period foods like pork roasted over fire and root vegetable soup
- **Family activities** include a Washington-themed scavenger hunt and a QR Code History Challenge
- **Admission:** $12 for adults, $7.50 for children; BCHS members free
- The event is partially funded by a NJ Department of State Division of Travel and Tourism grant

**Relevance to question:** This event falls on **February 22**, which is within the February 20–25 window in question, and could contribute to elevated Google search interest in "George Washington" during that period.
</Summary>

Here are the relevant news articles:

**Potential SCOTUS Tariff Ruling**
On Friday, February 20, 2026, the U.S. Supreme Court may issue a ruling on the legality of President Trump’s global tariffs, determining whether the president exceeded constitutional authority in imposing them. Alan B. Morrison, Lerner Family Associate Dean for Public Interest & Public Service at George Washington University Law School, is a nationally recognized constitutional law scholar and veteran Supreme Court advocate who has argued 20 cases before the Court. He co-founded the Public Citizen Litigation Group with Ralph Nader and spent over 25 years leading major law reform litigation, including landmark separation-of-powers cases such as INS v. Chadha. His expertise in challenging executive and congressional actions positions him as a leading authority on the constitutional limits of presidential power. His insights are particularly relevant to understanding the potential implications of the Court’s decision for trade policy and the scope of executive authority moving forward. For media inquiries, contact claire.sabin@gwu.edu.

The city of Philadelphia, led by Mayor Cherelle Parker, confirmed the exhibit’s restoration was underway. In Texas, CBS pulled Stephen Colbert’s interview with Democratic state representative James Talarico just before early voting began, citing FCC 'equal time' concerns under the Trump administration; Colbert aired the full interview on YouTube, calling it the 'interview Donald Trump didn't want you to see,' while CBS stated it only provided legal guidance.

**Bitcoin Searches for “Going to Zero” Skyrocket as Extreme Fear Grips Market**
Google search interest for Bitcoin and phrases such as 'is Bitcoin going to zero' reached a 12-month peak in early February 2026, coinciding with a 25% drop in Bitcoin’s price from $81,500 to nearly $60,000 over five days—the sharpest short-term decline since late 2024. This triggered a Crypto Fear & Greed Index reading of 5, marking 'Extreme Fear,' the lowest level since the 2022 market crisis. Search volume peaked at a Google Trends score of 100 during the week of February 1, reflecting widespread retail anxiety and fears of a 'death spiral.' The sell-off was fueled by institutional de-leveraging, a failed retest of the $70,000 psychological resistance level, and a 100% tariff announcement by former President Donald Trump on Chinese imports, which unsettled global risk-on markets. While some analysts, like Bloomberg’s Mike McGlone, warn of a crypto bubble collapse with a potential target of $10,000, others highlight bipartisan market structure legislation as a stabilizing force. A Matrix on Target report provides a framework for identifying Bitcoin’s cycle low and optimal entry points, referencing prior accurate forecasts such as the 2022 bull run signal, the $125,000 peak prediction for mid-2023, and the bearish trend confirmation after Bitcoin fell below key levels in late 2025. This episode follows a history of security breaches that have previously undermined investor confidence.

**Did George Will report Fox News cut away from Trump mid-speech? Watch out**
A fabricated YouTube video circulated in February 2026 claiming that Fox News cut away from U.S. President Donald Trump mid-speech during a Cabinet meeting in February 2026 because he appeared to be 'falling apart.' The video, titled '1 Minute Ago: Trump Falls Apart Staff Handling Him Legacy Panic & Black History Erasure |George Will,' falsely attributed commentary to conservative columnist George Will, using deepfake technology to manipulate his audio and visual appearance. The video, produced by the YouTube channel 'Politics Raw,' included a disclaimer stating that the content was digitally generated, but this was buried in the expanded description and likely overlooked by viewers. No credible news outlets reported such an incident, and there is no verified broadcast footage supporting the claim. Analysis shows the video reused authentic footage of Will from real interviews, digitally altering his mouth movements and voice to match a fabricated script. The background, lighting, and camera angle in the fake video closely resemble Will’s real appearances on C-SPAN, NewsNation, and The Washington Post. The channel, created in mid-January 2026, published multiple nearly identical videos with sensational titles like 'BREAKING' and '1 Minute Ago,' using AI-generated thumbnails mimicking Fox News branding. The video’s narrative included false claims about Trump’s mental decline, the Gateway Project funding controversy, the Kennedy Center renaming, and systemic erasure of Black history. Snopes rated the claim as fake, citing lack of evidence, synthetic audio, unnatural lip movements, and the channel’s pattern of clickbait content. No record exists of Will making these statements in his Washington Post columns, on social media, or in recent TV appearances. The Washington Post was contacted for comment but did not respond.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 19, 2026 12:00 PM
Source:[Snopes](https://www.snopes.com//fact-check/trump-fox-news-george-will/)

**Kremlin: Moscow Interested in Restoring Relations with Washington**
Dmitry Peskov, the spokesperson for the Russian presidency (the Kremlin), stated on Wednesday, February 18, 2026, that Russia remains highly interested in restoring trade, economic, and investment cooperation with the United States, as well as collaboration in other areas. Peskov emphasized that the relationship between Russian President Vladimir Putin and his American counterpart, Donald Trump, is strong and can serve as a foundation for new cooperation agreements that respect the shared interests of both countries across all fields.

**One-Minute World Overview: Google I/O 2026 to Feature AI Updates and Potential Smart Glasses Launch**
Alphabet announced on February 17, 2026, that the Google I/O annual developer conference will be held on May 19–20, 2026, with live streaming available on its official website. Market expectations suggest Google may unveil an updated Gemini model, other AI products, and potentially its first smart glasses. YouTube experienced a global outage on February 18, 2026, lasting about an hour before恢复正常. Nvidia disclosed it had sold its remaining 1.1 million shares in Arm in the fourth quarter of 2025, valued at approximately $140 million at the February 17 closing price, concluding a five-year dispute after its failed $40 billion acquisition attempt in 2020. Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced on February 17, 2026, a defense strategy to reduce reliance on the U.S., with investments exceeding CAD 500 billion (USD 3.66 billion), expected to create 125,000 new jobs in the sector over the next decade. The European Central Bank (ECB) denied reports that President Christine Lagarde plans to resign before October 2027, possibly ahead of the April 2027 French presidential election. Bayer’s subsidiary Monsanto proposed a settlement of up to USD 7.25 billion to resolve ongoing Roundup herbicide cancer lawsuits, though court approval is still pending; Bayer’s stock dropped over 8% during trading on February 18. In the UK, January’s consumer price index (CPI) annual inflation rate fell to 3%, the lowest in a year, driven by reduced food price increases, though service inflation remained above expectations. Investors largely anticipate a 0.25 percentage point interest rate cut next month, though some central bank officials remain concerned about inflation resurgence. Vietnam intensified penalties for illegal gold production, smuggling, and unlicensed trading to curb a booming black market, while promoting private sector participation and encouraging citizens to shift savings from gold bars to productive investments. The New Zealand Reserve Bank held its benchmark interest rate steady at 2.25% on February 18, 2026, as expected, but signaled that policy would remain accommodative for some time, causing the NZD/USD to fall 0.8%; the bank also announced it will increase its annual policy meetings from seven to eight starting next year to enhance transparency and accountability.

**George W. Bush Torches Trump in Presidents’ Day Message – Ya Libnan**
Former U.S. President George W. Bush delivered a Presidents’ Day essay that subtly criticized Donald Trump by highlighting qualities of George Washington that are currently lacking in contemporary leadership. Bush emphasized Washington’s humility, reverence for history and superior knowledge, self-restraint in power, and willingness to step down after two terms—choices that prevented America from becoming a monarchy. Bush noted that Washington’s decisions to relinquish power twice set a lasting standard for presidential conduct. The message carried implicit weight given Trump’s repeated challenges to election results, his 2020 election denial, and his public interest in running for a third term despite legal constraints. Bush underscored Washington’s role in shaping both the character of the presidency and the nation, stating he ‘embodied integrity’ and ‘put the good of the nation over self-interest.’
Original language: en
Publish date: February 17, 2026 01:38 AM
Source:[yalibnan.com](https://yalibnan.com/2026/02/17/george-w-bush-torches-trump-in-presidents-day-message/)

**Washington's Birthday: U.S. Stock and Bond Markets Closed for One Day on February 16**
The United States observed Washington's Birthday, also known as Presidents' Day, on Monday, February 16, 2026, resulting in a one-day closure of U.S. stock and bond markets. This federal holiday, established in 1971, honors the birthday of George Washington, the first U.S. president, and is celebrated on the third Monday of February each year. As a result of the holiday, financial markets remained closed on February 16, with normal trading resuming on February 17. The next scheduled market closure will be on Good Friday, April 3, 2026. The information is reported by Liberty Times Electronic News, which published the article on February 15, 2026, at 05:24.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 15, 2026 05:24 AM
Source:[自由時報電子報](https://ec.ltn.com.tw/article/breakingnews/5344088)

**Google Reveals Global Interests in 2025: AI, Sports, and Cultural Trends Dominate Search Trends**
According to Google's Year in Search 2025 report, global user interests were dominated by artificial intelligence, major sporting events, and geopolitical developments. Google's AI assistant Gemini ranked first globally, reflecting the widespread adoption of AI tools in daily life. Sports-related searches followed, with significant attention to cricket matches—particularly India vs. England and India vs. Australia—alongside major tournaments like the AFC Asian Cup and the FIFA Club World Cup, underscoring cricket's global popularity. Major news events also shaped search trends, including Iran-related topics, the U.S. government shutdown, the selection of a new Pope, the Los Angeles wildfires, Hurricane Melissa, and the TikTok ban. Interest in natural disasters increased, with searches for the Kamchatka earthquake and tsunami rising during the crisis. Culturally, users searched extensively for musicians and public figures such as d4vd and Kendrick Lamar, as well as Pope Leo XIV. Actress Mikey Madison topped global searches among actors following her standout role in the film 'Anora,' which became the most-searched film worldwide in 2025. In literature, contemporary romance novels and classic works gained traction, with 'Regretting You' by Colleen Hoover and 'Onyx Storm' by Rebecca Yaros leading global searches, while George Orwell’s 'Animal Farm' experienced a strong resurgence. In gaming, 'Arc Raiders' was the most-searched game globally. Travel and lifestyle searches reflected growing interest in cultural destinations and iconic landmarks, with historic libraries like Livraria Lello in Portugal and El Ateneo Grand Splendid in Argentina ranking among the most-searched locations on Google Maps. The report illustrates 2025 as a year marked by technological curiosity, global event engagement, cultural exploration, and everyday life detail-seeking.

**Pet-Friendly Presidential Stays**
Kimpton's The George Hotel in Washington, D.C., is offering two seasonal Presidential Stays packages for Presidents' Day. The 'Presidential Pet Package' is designed for guests traveling with pets and includes locally made welcome treats, a framed presidential-style pet portrait, a pet bed, food and water bowls, a curated pet-friendly itinerary, and a discount code for grooming services at Colby's Dog Care & Spa. The 'First Family Package' targets families and features discounted parking, reduced rates on an adjoining second room, kid-friendly welcome treats, sightseeing backpacks and water bottles, and a daily electric scooter credit. The hotel, located steps from Union Station and near major historic landmarks, integrates presidential-inspired design elements throughout its guest experience, reflecting its name and location. The packages are part of a limited-time seasonal initiative announced on January 5, 2026, by Trend Hunter.

**AP Trending SummaryBrief at 12:18 a.m. EST**
Bowen Yang will leave 'Saturday Night Live' after the Christmas episode hosted by Ariana Grande, having joined as a writer in 2018, becoming a featured player in 2019, and a main cast member in 2021. He has earned five Emmy nominations and co-hosts the podcast 'Las Culturistas,' appearing as Pfannee in the 'Wicked' films. In northeast India, a high-speed passenger train killed seven wild Asiatic elephants and injured a calf in Assam; the accident occurred on a non-designated elephant corridor, with five train coaches and the engine derailing—no human casualties were reported. Ford is recalling over 270,000 electric and hybrid vehicles (2022–2026 F-150 Lightnings, 2024–2026 Mustang Mach-Es, and 2025–2026 Mavericks) due to a software flaw in the park module that may fail to lock into park, potentially causing roll-away risk; Ford will provide a free software update. Sony acquired a 41% stake in 'Peanuts' from WildBrain for $457 million, increasing its ownership to 80%, while the Schulz family retains 20%; Sony previously acquired its first stake in 2018. President Donald Trump announced that nine pharmaceutical companies—including Amgen, Bristol Myers Squibb, Gilead Sciences, and Novartis—will charge Medicaid the same prices as in other developed nations and adopt 'most-favored-nation' pricing for new drugs across all markets. The U.S. Department of Transportation's Secretary Sean Duffy’s daughter, Evita Duffy-Alfonso, criticized the TSA for an 'absurdly invasive' pat-down during a pregnancy-related scanner exemption, calling the agency 'unconstitutional' and suggesting her father would limit it. A lion and bear rescued from illegal captivity in Albania were transported to German wildlife sanctuaries in early December after being identified via TikTok videos; the 70-hour journey ended on December 13. In Rome, restorers used laser beams to clean a 154-foot-tall Roman column of Marcus Aurelius—built A.D. 180–193—marking the first major restoration in 40 years; previous efforts used brushes. In Washington, President Trump added new plaques to the Presidential Walk of Fame, labeling Barack Obama as 'one of the most divisive presidents' and portraying Ronald Reagan as a fan of young Trump, while calling Joe Biden 'Sleepy Joe'; the walkway was declared by Trump as a tribute to past presidents 'good, bad, and somewhere in the middle.'

**Traveler's View | A Ridiculous Move**
The Trump administration plans to place President Donald Trump's image on the 2026 America the Beautiful annual park entrance pass, alongside George Washington, sparking criticism. This move follows a series of controversial actions, including cutting nearly a quarter of the National Park Service workforce, proposing a $1 billion budget reduction that could eliminate about 350 park units, and downplaying climate change. The Interior Department, under Secretary Doug Burgum, will also designate June 14—the president’s birthday—as a free entrance day, while removing Martin Luther King Jr.’s birthday from the list of free days. Critics argue that no individual politician should be featured on park passes, and the decision is seen as emblematic of a broader disregard for the National Park Service. The annual pass can be purchased before December 31, 2025, to remain valid through December 31, 2026.

**White House Unveils New "Walk of Fame" with Surprise for Biden**
On September 24, 2025, Semana.com reported that the White House inaugurated a new "Walk of Fame" in the hallway of columns leading to the Oval Office, featuring black‑and‑white portraits of U.S. presidents from George Washington to the current president. The gallery, visible from the Rosaleda, was expected to be a symbol of American sovereignty and history. However, the portrait slot for former President Joe Biden was filled with an "autopen"—a device that automatically signs documents—rather than a photograph. The article notes that Trump appeared "perplejo" by the detail and had previously warned that the Walk would be "polémica". Trump also ordered an investigation in June into the use of the autopen for signing executive orders and other documents during Biden’s presidency, claiming it was used to mask Biden’s alleged cognitive decline. Biden, 82, responded, "Seamos claros: tomé las decisiones durante mi Presidencia. Tomé las decisiones sobre los indultos, las órdenes ejecutivas, la legislación y las proclamaciones. Cualquier insinuación de que no lo hice es ridícula y falsa." The autopen portrait will be visible to guests attending a dinner at the Garden of Roses on Wednesday, a venue Trump has renovated as part of broader White House updates. Trump has also moved Barack Obama’s portrait from its original location and has hung several of his own portraits, continuing a trend of significant decor changes.
Original language: es
